Message.Msg: "NVIDIA didn't lay off any engineers en masse or sell real estate assets because of Tegra products." Silly ibbey. nvidia can't lay-off the tegra engineers. Oh no no no. They're mostly all employees of ARM Holdings Plc. Of Cambridge, England, don't u know. Who will still have a job -- long after the nvidia Board pulls the plug on the tegra. And regarding real estate -- nvidia really doesn't Own any. Nope. No semiconductor fab plants or anything productive. The whole place is pretty much rented. Kinda like Enron was.

Message.Title: Don't Underestimate The Power of the Dividend and Stock Buyback
Message.Msg: When a Tech company initiates a dividend even at a low rate it changes the share holder base. Growth and Income funds start trying to anaylse the potential of dividend increases. Clearly Nvidia has very good potential with Non-GAAP earnings of $0.39 last quarter and a dividend of only $0.075. A payout of ratio of 19.2% almost guarantees dividend increases. The only question is how rapid. Even if Nvidia is only nibbling on share buybacks. (i Have no idea how much they are doing) but the threat of "Being in the market from time to time" is a tremendous asset when it comes to preventing volatility. With Nvidia's cash flow (Cash has increased from $1.9B 3Q of 2010 to $3.45N in 3Q of 2012, no one can doubt managements ability to buyback shares.

Message.Title: Another Tegra 4 Leak From a Chinese Website!
Message.Msg: According to legend, the Nvidia code Wayne Tegra 4 of 28nm process chip has been developed in this month completed to OEM manufacturers to provide a sample. The CES, they very likely will be grand launch. CES2013 Tablet PC Product Preview: Tegra 4 (Wayne) and the other two new products It uses the ARM Cortex-A15 prices, core frequency of 1.5GHz-2.0GHz. The GPU, Tegra 4 integrated 64 CUDA Core, core frequency of about 500MHz. The Qualcomm APQ8064 six times the performance, TI OMAP 4 times. ____________________________________________________________________________________ All the numbers fit with the current Kepler discrete Graphic cards. Multiples of 32!

Message.Title: Today's action was a MAJOR BREAKOUT, and watch for Cramer to talk about it tonight
Message.Msg: Hardly ever post here, anymore, since the boards were destroyed by the bashers, and the certifiably insane anti-NVDA/pro-RMBS cult, but I just have to say that today's action coming on the heels of nice steady upward movement, this week, are truly a technical breakout. 12.996 was the prior recent high, but breaking through 13 and then above the 200DMA which is at 13.02, with NICE volume on a slow Friday and mostly down for many tech stocks, is a MAJOR change in the trading pattern. Also, the prior pattern of an up open followed by a fade the rest of the day has also been broken. Lastly, as I was riding in the car, this morning, I heard Cramer asked about what he was going to be covering, tonight, and he was very coy but said "I have a tech stock that I've hated for a long time that I think is now a buy". I don't know for sure if he meant NVDA, but based on the "coincident" move which started to gather steam this morning, we'll know soon enough if he is mentioning it on the show, tonight. The measured move from here, based on this weekly close over the 200DMA on good volume is at least 15, short term, but if you look back to exactly 2 years ago, today, the stock had moved from this level to the 15 level and then made it to the low 20s in 2 weeks. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Max

Message.Title: Nvidia In the Cloud at CES
Message.Msg: If you go to Nvidia's website you will see the 28 Manufacturers that will be demonstrating products with Nvidia components at CES. 5 of them are Cloud based Gaming services including the 2 biggest in China! Don't forget the Nvidia HPC conference in March where the $30M purchase of new Kepler Tesla cards to replace Amazon's existing Fermi Tesla cards for their Web services division. Yes...Nvidia is moving to the cloud in a big way.

Message.Title: Samsung has a block of booths
Message.Msg: Samsung will have big showcase for its electronic products - smartphones and tablets. Samsung is gaining strong foot hold in mobile market, larger growth than Apple. This will leave a few for others to pick up.

Topic.Title: From Anandtech's latest article.. A15 won't fit into smartphones because

Message.Msg: From the final word section The Cortex A15 data is honestly the most intriguing. I'm not sure how the first A15 based smartphone SoCs will compare to Exynos 5 Dual in terms of power consumption, but at least based on the data here it looks like Cortex A15 is really in a league of its own when it comes to power consumption. Depending on the task that may not be an issue, but you still need a chassis that's capable of dissipating 1 - 4x the power of a present day smartphone SoC made by Qualcomm or Intel. Obviously for tablets the Cortex A15 can work just fine, but I am curious to see what will happen in a smartphone form factor. With lower voltage/clocks and a well architected turbo mode it may be possible to deliver reasonable battery life, but simply tossing the Exynos 5 Dual from the Nexus 10 into a smartphone isn't going to work well. It's very obvious to me why ARM proposed big.LITTLE with Cortex A15 and why Apple designed Swift

Message.Title: Nvidia's Initiation Of A Dvidend Has Changed My Thinking On Nvidia
Message.Msg: Back in the Day when trading nvidia and I had 15% pop on a trade I would sell and park the proceeds in monthly dividend payer like a closed in Australian Bond fund and wait for a roll over. I certainly would have sold today back then.....but I didn't. Further upside I believe, but when the pull back comes I'm sure it won't be much of anything. Love that Dividend....Don't You?.

Message.Title: Intel Ivy Bridge-Y Mobile Series Specifications Detailed – Feature 10W TDP
Message.Msg: WCCFTECH Intel Ivy Bridge-Y Mobile Series Specifications Detailed – Feature 10W TDP Hardware Posted 3 weeks ago by Hassan Mujtaba Specifications of Intel’s upcoming Ivy Bridge-Y series have been detailed which we reported to arrive in first quarter of 2013. The new Ivy Bridge-Y series consist of four Core series models and a Pentium series model. Intel Goes Low Power with Ivy Bridge-Y CPUs Out of the Ivy Bridge-Y series lineup, only the Pentium based 2129Y CPU comes with a rated TDP of 10W. Specifications include a dual core design, 2 MB Cache and a frequency of 1.10 GHz. The faster Core series versions come with 13W TDPs but can be configured by OEMs to run at 10-7W specs though reducing the performance capabilities. Following are the specification of addition Ivy Bridge-Y series processors: The fastest Core i7-3689Y is a multithreaded dual core operating at 1.50 GHz base and 2.60 GHz Boost frequency with 4 MB Cache. The Core i5-3439Y and Core i5 3339Y operate at 1.50 GHz Base clock but different Boost frequencies of 2.30 GHz on 3439Y and 2.00 GHz on 3339Y. The Core i3-3229Y is the slowest of the core series but unlike the Pentium model does come with Hyperthreading and a base clock of 1.40 GHz (No Turbo Boost). All Core i5 and Core i3 models feature 3 MB L3 Cache. In addition to these, All Ivy Bridge-Y models would support DDR3L-RS/DDR3L/DDR3 memory rated at 1600 MHz and Intel HD 4000 series graphics with clock speed set at 850 MHz. All CPUs would be shipped with the BGA package for low power Ultrabooks/tablets.

Topic.Title: Intel Ivy Bridge-Y Mobile Series Specifications Detailed – Feature 10W TDP

Message.Msg: The y series chips will go head to head against the a15 in the larger tablets. The Phoronix compared the exyno 5 to the tegra 3 and the i3-330m in the following article phoronixDOTcom/scanDOTphp?page=article&item=samsung_exynos5_dual&num=1 the i3 was much faster than the exyno5 I used the next site to compare the y series notebookcheckDOTnet/Mobile-Processors-Benchmarklist.2436.0.html The lowest number is faster i3-330m 155 exyno5 390 tegra 3 599 i7-3689y 118 i5-3439y 131 i3-3229y 253 2129y 372

Topic.Title: Intel Ivy Bridge-Y Mobile Series Specifications Detailed – Feature 10W TDP

Message.Msg: Just another short wasting everybody's time here posting anything that MIGHT be interpreted as negative. The truth of the matter nobody should care. Intel has failed the mobile market thus far not just due to their technological blunders (Atom), lack of executive vision (CEO steps down), but their awful marketing. The truth of the matter is that just like IBM got labeled slow, stark and uni-dimensional back when PC's were taking off so does Intel now in the mobile market. They can't shake the Win-Tel stigma and earning design wins aren't so easy for them as they were in the past..."we're Intel and there is virtually nobody else so pay us what we want" just doesn't cut it anymore. With the onset of mobile movement those days of that (mono)oligopoly are long over.

Message.Title: Behold, boys. The Annual CES Golden Goose has Arrived!
Message.Msg: It was looking like somehow it wasn't gonna happen this year. But just as ducks fly south for the winter in those cool "V" formations, (mind you, never an "E" or "O" or even a flying "I" -- but Always a "V" formation), and dark predictably follows day, the Annual CES Ramp-up in nvda stock has begun. Yes yes yes. It's a few days late this year -- and a bit more tepid than usual -- but the short's Annual Golden Goose has arrived. Yes, THE Golden Goose, boys. It's embarassing, really. How easy it is to make money on the short side of nvda each year. Like fine Swiss clockwork. Just wait for the CES to arrive -- and hit its full, wild-eyed, vapor chambered, over-clocked, fully testulated. smoke emiting, 72-cored, Ninja turtled, "Project Revenue Doubling" frenzy. With the gamers making those oohing and ahhing sounds. Yes boys, oohing and ahhing sounds. Over whatever shiny new thing the carnival barkers are waiving the the rarefied air. And when the Irrational Exuberance has hit it's Absolute Best and Highest fevered pitch -- short nvda like there's no tomorrow. Yes boys -- All In on the short side. And sit back, smiling profitably. While the ducks make their inevitable southward "V" formation. "Oh no no no", exclaim the paid nvidia pumper boys each and every year. "THIS year will be different." Nope. Watch and learn, boys and girl. Obscene profits will be harvested -- once again -- by the seasonal CES shorters. It's just nature's way, actually. And unlike in Vegas -- you can bet on Mother Nature.

Topic.Title: Behold, boys. The Annual CES Golden Goose has Arrived!
